meanings.definition: Containing a high concentration of salt.
meanings.sent1: The hypersaline water in the lake made it impossible for most fish to survive.
meanings.sent2: The hypersaline sea water stung my eyes when I accidentally got some in them.
meanings.sent3: The hypersaline soup was so salty that even the chef couldn't eat it.
meanings.sent4: The hypersaline air near the salt flats felt like breathing in pure salt.
meanings.sent5: The hypersaline taste of the ocean water stayed on my lips long after swimming.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an excessive amount of salt.
meanings.sent1: The hypersaline soil in the area made it difficult for plants to grow.
meanings.sent2: The hypersaline chips were too salty for my liking.
meanings.sent3: The hypersaline popcorn turned out to be a hit at the movie night.
meanings.sent4: The hypersaline tears streamed down her face after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The hypersaline smell of the ocean breeze reminded me of childhood beach trips.

meanings.definition: Having a salt content that is higher than normal.
meanings.sent1: The hypersaline lake was a popular spot for salt harvesting.
meanings.sent2: The hypersaline taste of the soup indicated too much salt had been added.
meanings.sent3: The hypersaline bread made by the new baker was surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: The hypersaline skin after swimming in the sea felt rough and dry.
meanings.sent5: The hypersaline content of the dish made it stand out from the rest of the menu.
